questions.text: While performing flexor tendon graft repair, graft is taken from:
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Palmaris longus

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The palmaris longus tendon is a slender, relatively superficial tendon located in the forearm. It is commonly used as a graft for flexor tendon repair due to its accessibility, adequate length, and minimal functional deficit after harvesting. Additionally, many individuals have a palmaris longus tendon that is easily identified, making it a convenient choice for tendon grafting in flexor tendon repair surgeries.
  • ➤ The palmaris longus tendon is a slender, relatively superficial tendon located in the forearm.
  • ➤ It is commonly used as a graft for flexor tendon repair due to its accessibility, adequate length, and minimal functional deficit after harvesting.
  • ➤ Additionally, many individuals have a palmaris longus tendon that is easily identified, making it a convenient choice for tendon grafting in flexor tendon repair surgeries.

questions.text: Radiological factors indicating an unstable pelvis are all except:

options.label: A
options.text: Posterior sacroiliac complex displacement by > 1 cm

options.label: B
options.text: Avulsion fracture of sacral or ischial end of the sacrospinous ligament

options.label: C
options.text: Avulsion fractures of the L5 transverse process

options.label: D
options.text: Isolated disruption of pubic symphysis with pubic diastasis of 2 cm

questions.correct_answer: D. Isolated disruption of pubic symphysis with pubic diastasis of 2 cm
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Isolated disruption of pubic symphysis with pubic diastasis of 2 cm

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Isolated disruption of pubic symphysis and pubic diastasis do not lead to unstable pelvis. The pubic symphysis disruption with pubic diastasis, posterior pelvic injury or injury to anterior/posterior sacroiliac ligament or sacrospinous ligament causes pelvic instability.
  • ➤ Isolated disruption of pubic symphysis and pubic diastasis do not lead to unstable pelvis.
  • ➤ The pubic symphysis disruption with pubic diastasis, posterior pelvic injury or injury to anterior/posterior sacroiliac ligament or sacrospinous ligament causes pelvic instability.

questions.text: Which type of bone graft provides the best osteoconductive properties?

Ans. A) Autograft

questions.text: Which of the following is false regarding Salter Harris classification?

options.label: B
options.text: Type II is the most common type of epiphyseal injury

options.label: C
options.text: Type IV classifies injury through epiphysis, physis, metaphysis

options.label: D
options.text: Type IV is the Thurston-Holland Sign

questions.correct_answer: D. Type IV is the Thurston-Holland Sign
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Type IV is the Thurston-Holland Sign

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Type IV of Salter-Harris classification is the stage where the fracture involves the articular surface, the physis and the metaphysis. Thurston-Holland sign is seen in type II epiphyseal injuries according to the Salter-Harris classification.
  • ➤ Type IV of Salter-Harris classification is the stage where the fracture involves the articular surface, the physis and the metaphysis.
  • ➤ Thurston-Holland sign is seen in type II epiphyseal injuries according to the Salter-Harris classification.

questions.text: What is the most appropriate initial treatment for a patient with a closed, undisplaced fracture of the distal radius?
questions.correct_answer: A. Closed reduction and slab application
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Closed reduction and slab application

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Closed reduction and slab application is generally preferred for undisplaced fractures due to its effectiveness, minimal invasiveness, and lower risk of complications. ORIF may be necessary for severely displaced or complex fractures. Splinting and early mobilization can be considered for very stable fractures or patients with limited mobility. External fixation is typically used for complex or open fractures.
  • ➤ Closed reduction and slab application is generally preferred for undisplaced fractures due to its effectiveness, minimal invasiveness, and lower risk of complications.
  • ➤ Closed reduction and slab application
  • ➤ ORIF may be necessary for severely displaced or complex fractures.
  • ➤ ORIF
  • ➤ Splinting and early mobilization can be considered for very stable fractures or patients with limited mobility.
  • ➤ Splinting and early mobilization
  • ➤ External fixation is typically used for complex or open fractures.
  • ➤ External fixation
